history.content: When I took 170 + 188 + 61C it was really stressful for me, and the next semester I only took 161 + 186 along with breadth classes and I had a lot of time to do interview prep so I think it may be doable. With Weaver 161 is low workload and same with 186. 16B can be more time consuming but it's not that bad.

children.subject: I'm currently taking 186/161/math53 and I'd say it's definitely doable. 16b was a little more time-consuming than math 53 though (mainly due to labs), but I'd still say it's manageable.

170 + 188 together is super manageable. I feel like I could take my mind off the class for a night and not fall behind kinda thing. There's a lot less busy work compared to lower div classes - cept 188 can be overbearing at times. And they complement each other conceptually pretty frequently. It's a nice balance between a project class and theory/math class.

I was also considering 170+188, but I've been hearing quite a bit about how 188 isn't that useful, and was considering switching 188 with EE16b or cs61c.

Do you think 188 is worth taking (and if not, which of the two remaining lowerdivs should I take with 170)?

I would agree with the sentiment that 188 isn't the most applicable upper div for industry. Personally, I don't enjoy the class, in terms of content, as much as I thought I would. But it's run very well. Taken in the right semester, you have the opportunity being taught by the leading expert in AI/ML (I love Russell). 

If ur thinking of 189, 188 is a great intro/get your feet wet type class for AI/ML.

I still think the class is pretty worth it especially if you want a lighter but pretty reasonable upper div and you get to say I learned from "AI founder person" 

In terms of class combos, It def comes down to the person.

I highly recommend against 170 + 61C, cuz 61C is incredibly more work and content than 61A + 61b and projects are ROUGH, and you probably will need to spend more time on 170 if ur not the most theory savvy - hw's are hard. If you can space it out, do it. I don't see the point in putting yourself through hell when you don't have to. Ofc there are people who can handle it, and that's up to you to decide. 

In terms of workload 170 + 188 < 170 + 16b < 170 + 61c.
How is the balance of taking 170 + 188 together?

history.content:
need advice. any is welcome.

Is this doable? I'm a very avg CS student. I've taken 16a and 54 and all lower divs besides 16b. Also wondering how this compares to 170 + 188 which is what I'm taking rn. For ec's , I'll be volunteering a weeks during the semester - 5 hrs at most - and I'm hoping to PM for my club again. 

Edit: shoulda mentioned this but sahai is teaching 16b.
history.subject: 161 + 186 + 16b
